from pyspark.sql import functions as F
from notebookutils import mssparkutils

BASE = "abfss://horizon-migration-poc@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net"
EXTRACT = f"{BASE}/MPESC-EXTRACT"
OUT = f"{BASE}/TRANSFORM-CASE"

CASE_REF_FILE = f"{EXTRACT}/Horizon_CaseReference.csv"
LLATTR_CASE_GLOB = f"{EXTRACT}/LLAttr/Case_*/part*.csv"

case_ref = spark.read.option("header", True).option("inferSchema", True).csv(CASE_REF_FILE)

display(case_ref.limit(10))
print("case_ref rows:", case_ref.count())

PREFIXES = ["COM/", "ENV/", "MCA/", "PUR/", "ROW/"]

prefix_filter = None
for p in PREFIXES:
    cond = F.col("CaseReference").startswith(p)
    prefix_filter = cond if prefix_filter is None else (prefix_filter | cond)

filtered_cases = (
    case_ref
    .filter(prefix_filter)
    .select(
        F.col("CaseUniqueId").alias("caseReference"),
        F.col("CaseReference").alias("hznReference"),
        F.col("CaseTypeId").alias("caseTypeId"),
        F.col("CaseNodeId").alias("caseNodeId"),
        F.col("CaseCreateDate").alias("caseCreateDate"),
        F.col("CaseCloseDate").alias("caseCloseDate"),
        F.col("CaseCloseStatus").alias("caseCloseStatus"),
        F.col("CaseOwnerId").alias("caseOwnerId")
    )
)

display(filtered_cases.limit(10))
print("filtered cases:", filtered_cases.count())

PREFIXES = ["COM/", "ENV/", "MCA/", "PUR/", "ROW/"]

prefix_filter = None
for p in PREFIXES:
    cond = F.col("CaseReference").startswith(p)
    prefix_filter = cond if prefix_filter is None else (prefix_filter | cond)

filtered_cases = (
    case_ref
    .filter(prefix_filter)
    .select(
        F.col("CaseUniqueId").alias("caseReference"),
        F.col("CaseReference").alias("hznReference"),
        F.col("CaseTypeId").alias("caseTypeId"),
        F.col("CaseNodeId").alias("caseNodeId"),
        F.col("CaseCreateDate").alias("caseCreateDate"),
        F.col("CaseCloseDate").alias("caseCloseDate"),
        F.col("CaseCloseStatus").alias("caseCloseStatus"),
        F.col("CaseOwnerId").alias("caseOwnerId")
    )
)

display(filtered_cases.limit(10))
print("filtered cases:", filtered_cases.count())

from pyspark.sql import functions as F

BASE = "abfss://horizon-migration-poc@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net"
EXTRACT = f"{BASE}/MPESC-EXTRACT"
OUT = f"{BASE}/TRANSFORM-CASE"

CASE_REF_FILE = f"{EXTRACT}/Horizon_CaseReference.csv"

# your prefixes
PREFIXES = ["COM/", "ENV/", "MCA/", "PUR/", "ROW/"]

case_ref = spark.read.option("header", True).option("inferSchema", True).csv(CASE_REF_FILE)

prefix_filter = None
for p in PREFIXES:
    cond = F.col("CaseReference").startswith(p)
    prefix_filter = cond if prefix_filter is None else (prefix_filter | cond)

filtered_cases = (
    case_ref
    .filter(prefix_filter)
    .select(
        F.col("CaseUniqueId").alias("caseReference"),
        F.col("CaseReference").alias("hznReference"),
        F.col("CaseTypeId").alias("caseTypeId"),
        F.col("CaseNodeId").alias("caseNodeId"),
        F.col("CaseCreateDate").alias("caseCreateDate"),
        F.col("CaseCloseDate").alias("caseCloseDate"),
        F.col("CaseCloseStatus").alias("caseCloseStatus"),
        F.col("CaseOwnerId").alias("caseOwnerId")
    )
    .dropDuplicates(["caseReference"])
)

display(filtered_cases.limit(10))
print("filtered cases:", filtered_cases.count())

LLATTR_CASE_GLOB = f"{EXTRACT}/LLAttr/Case_*/part*.csv"

ll_case = spark.read.option("header", True).option("inferSchema", True).csv(LLATTR_CASE_GLOB)

# Ensure join keys are same type
cases_keys = filtered_cases.select(F.col("caseNodeId").cast("string").alias("caseNodeIdKey")).dropDuplicates()

attrs_filtered = (
    ll_case
    .withColumn("ID", F.col("ID").cast("string"))
    .join(cases_keys, F.col("ID") == F.col("caseNodeIdKey"), "inner")
    .drop("caseNodeIdKey")
)

print("attrs_filtered:", attrs_filtered.count())
display(attrs_filtered.limit(5))

# Common system-ish columns we usually don't want in the final wide dataset
drop_cols = [c for c in ["AttrID", "AttrType", "DataType",  "RowNum", "Partition", "FileName"] if c in attrs_filtered.columns]

attrs_clean = attrs_filtered.drop(*drop_cols)

print("Dropped cols:", drop_cols)
print("Remaining attr cols:", len(attrs_clean.columns))

# If attrs has multiple rows per ID, collapse to 1 row per ID
# (prevents case duplication)
attrs_one_row = attrs_clean.dropDuplicates(["ID"])

cases_joined = (
    filtered_cases.alias("c")
    .join(
        attrs_one_row.alias("a"),
        F.col("c.caseNodeId").cast("string") == F.col("a.ID").cast("string"),
        "left"
    )
    .drop("ID")  # since we already have caseNodeId
)

display(cases_joined.limit(10))
print("cases_joined rows:", cases_joined.count())

TYPE_OF_CASE_FILE = f"{EXTRACT}/Horizon_TypeOfCase.csv"
type_of_case = spark.read.option("header", True).option("inferSchema", True).csv(TYPE_OF_CASE_FILE)

final_df = (
    cases_joined.alias("x")
    .join(type_of_case.alias("t"), F.col("x.caseTypeId") == F.col("t.ID"), "left")
    .drop(F.col("t.ID"))
)

display(final_df.limit(10))

attr_rename_map = {
    "89": "act",
    "100": "appealAgainst",
    "53": "appellantFormTypeSubmitted",
    "84": "appellantReasonsWRNotSufficient",
    "91": "applicationSubtype",
    "80": "appointedBy",
    "104": "band",
    "40": "bespokeIndicator",
    "85": "caseProcess",
    "52": "casePublishFlag",
    "2": "caseTypeAttr",
    "81": "caseworkMarker",
    "47": "caseworkReason",
    "45": "costsAppliedForIndicator",
    "95": "deccRef",
    "74": "decision",
    "79": "decisionBranch",
    "92": "decisionClearForDespatch",
    "46": "decisionIssue",
    "9": "developmentType",
    "17": "developmentAllegationDescription",
    "73": "englandWalesIndicator",
    "99": "eprType",
    "83": "fileLocation",
    "75": "groundADPALapsedIndicator",
    "82": "importantInformation",
    "7": "jurisdiction",
    "54": "level",
    "51": "linkedStatus",
    "76": "lpaCode",
    "77": "lpaName",
    "70": "nationalPlanningCaseworkReference",
    "94": "nfa",
    "93": "omaStance",
    "69": "otherRelatedAppeals",
    "72": "portalUrl",
    "5": "procedure",
    "4": "procedureAppellant",
    "3": "procedureLpa",
    "55": "processingStateAttr",
    "68": "redeterminedIndicator",
    "87": "regulation",
    "88": "regulator",
    "96": "sch6Notice",
    "90": "section",
    "97": "slaDateMet",
    "71": "sourceIndicator",
    "78": "specialCircumstances",
    "60": "specialism",
    "102": "standardPriority",
    "98": "targetDateMet",
    "101": "validity"
}

print(sorted(final_df_named.columns))
display(final_df_named.limit(10))
df = final_df_named.cache()
df.count()

from pyspark.sql import functions as F

case_type_map = {
    "2":  "call-ins",
    "17": "coastal-access",
    "18": "common-land",
    "19": "environment",
    "20": "high-hedges",
    "21": "other-sos-casework",
    "22": "purchase-notices",
    "23": "rights-of-way"
}

keys_list = list(case_type_map.keys())
map_expr = F.create_map([F.lit(x) for kv in case_type_map.items() for x in kv])

df_mapped = df.withColumn(
    "caseTypeName",
    F.when(
        F.col("caseTypeId").cast("string").isin(keys_list),
        map_expr.getItem(F.col("caseTypeId").cast("string"))
    ).otherwise(F.lit(None))
)

df_mapped.select("caseTypeId", "caseTypeName") \
    .distinct() \
    .orderBy(F.col("caseTypeId").cast("int")) \
    .show(truncate=False)
display(df_mapped.limit(10))

from pyspark.sql import functions as F

df.groupBy("applicationSubtype").count().show(100, truncate=False)

from pyspark.sql import functions as F

application_subtype_map = {
    # Rights of Way
    "DMMO under WCA: 7": "opposed-dmmo",
    "DMMO under WCA: 8": "opposed-dmmo",
    "Appeal under WCA: 14A": "schedule-14-appeal",
    "Direction under WCA: 14D": "schedule-14-direction",
    "Diversion under HA: 4": "opposed-ppo-ha80",
    "Creation under HA: 6": "opposed-ppo-ha80",
    "Extinguishment under HA: 3": "opposed-ppo-ha80",
    "Stopping up or diversion of highways": "opposed-ppo-ha80",
    "Stopping up or diversion under TCPA: 5": "opposed-ppo-tcpa90",

    # Trees / High Hedges
    "High Hedges": "high-hedges",
    "Tree Preservation Orders": "tree-lopping",
    "Tree Preservation Orders (Fast track)": "tree-lopping",
    "Tree Replacement Notices": "tree-lopping",
    "Tree Replacement Notices (Fast track)": "tree-lopping",

    # Common Land
    "Compulsory Purchase Order": "compulsory-purchase-cl",

    "Notice Appeals": "notice-appeal",

    # Other SOS
    "Discontinuance Order": "discontinuance-notice",
}

map_expr = F.create_map(
    [F.lit(x) for kv in application_subtype_map.items() for x in kv]
)

df_mapped = df_mapped.withColumn(
    "applicationSubtypeMapped",
    map_expr.getItem(F.col("applicationSubtype"))
)

df_mapped.select(
    "applicationSubtype",
    "applicationSubtypeMapped"
).distinct().orderBy("applicationSubtype").show(truncate=False)

from pyspark.sql import functions as F
df_mapped = df_mapped.withColumn("caseOfficerId", F.lit("D02A7E74-C3FD-4C4D-9C9C-6E21C33282DF"))

df_mapped = df_mapped.withColumn(
    "receivedDate",
    F.coalesce(F.col("caseCreateDate"), F.current_timestamp())
)

df_mapped = df_mapped.withColumn("name", F.col("hznReference"))
df_mapped.select("caseOfficerId").show(10, truncate=False)

# Get SQL password securely from Key Vault
akv_name = "pinskvsynwodwdevuks"      # your Key Vault name
secret_name = "mpesc-sql-password"   # the secret storing the SQL password

sql_password = mssparkutils.credentials.getSecret(akv_name, secret_name)

server = "pins-sql-peas-primary-dev.database.windows.net"
database = "pins-sqldb-peas-dev"

url = f"jdbc:sqlserver://{server}:1433;database={database};encrypt=true;trustServerCertificate=false;hostNameInCertificate=*.database.windows.net;loginTimeout=30;"

from pyspark.sql import functions as F

# Pull Address GUIDs using legacyCaseId
address_lookup = (
    spark.read.format("jdbc")
    .option("url", url)
    .option("query", """
        SELECT
            CAST(legacyCaseId AS varchar(50)) AS legacyCaseId,
            CAST(id AS varchar(36)) AS addressGuid
        FROM dbo.Address
        WHERE legacyCaseId IS NOT NULL
    """)
    .option("user", "peas_app_ZXzkE0vP")
    .option("password", sql_password)
    .load()
    .dropDuplicates(["legacyCaseId"])

df_mapped = (
    df_mapped
    .withColumn("caseNodeId_str", F.col("caseNodeId").cast("string"))
    .join(
        F.broadcast(address_lookup)
            .withColumnRenamed("legacyCaseId", "caseNodeId_str"),
        on="caseNodeId_str",
        how="left"
    )
    .drop("caseNodeId_str")
)

# 3) Quick check
df_mapped.select("caseNodeId", "addressGuid").show(20, truncate=False)
df_mapped = df_mapped.withColumn("band", F.lit("band-1"))

from pyspark.sql.functions import col, trim, when, expr

cases_path = "abfss://horizon-migration-poc@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/config/Cases/Cases.csv"

cases_df = (
    spark.read.format("csv")
    .option("header", "true")
    .option("inferSchema", "false")
    .option("sep", ",")          # change to ";" or "\t" if needed
    .option("quote", "\"")
    .option("escape", "\"")
    .option("multiLine", "true")
    .load(cases_path)
)

print("Columns:", cases_df.columns)
display(cases_df)

from pyspark.sql.functions import trim, col

case_ids = [
    str(r["Case ID"]).strip()
    for r in cases_df
        .select(trim(col("Case ID")).alias("Case ID"))
        .collect()
    if r["Case ID"] is not None and str(r["Case ID"]).strip() != ""
]

case_ids

from pyspark.sql import functions as F

# --- Normalise columns + ensure GUID exists ---
cases_df2 = cases_df

# If GUID column doesn't exist, create it
if "GUID" not in cases_df2.columns:
    cases_df2 = cases_df2.withColumn("GUID", F.lit(None).cast("string"))

# Trim values
cases_df2 = (
    cases_df2
    .withColumn("Case ID", F.trim(F.col("Case ID")).cast("string"))
    .withColumn("GUID", F.trim(F.col("GUID")).cast("string"))
    .filter(F.col("Case ID").isNotNull() & (F.col("Case ID") != ""))
)

# --- Generate GUID only where missing/blank ---
cases_df2 = cases_df2.withColumn(
    "GUID",
    F.when(F.col("GUID").isNull() | (F.col("GUID") == ""), F.expr("uuid()"))
     .otherwise(F.col("GUID"))
)

display(cases_df2)

# --- Write back to Cases.csv idempotently ---
tmp_folder = "abfss://horizon-migration-poc@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/config/Cases/_tmp_cases_with_guids/"
final_folder = "abfss://horizon-migration-poc@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/config/Cases/"
final_file = final_folder + "Cases.csv"

# write a single part file
(cases_df2
 .select("Case ID", "GUID")
 .coalesce(1)
 .write.mode("overwrite")
 .format("csv")
 .option("header", "true")
 .save(tmp_folder)
)

# find the part file spark created
files = mssparkutils.fs.ls(tmp_folder)
part_files = [f.path for f in files if f.name.startswith("part-") and f.name.endswith(".csv")]
if len(part_files) != 1:
    raise Exception(f"Expected exactly 1 part file in temp folder, found {len(part_files)}: {part_files}")

part_file = part_files[0]

# overwrite the real Cases.csv with the generated part file
# (delete old first to avoid "already exists" issues)
try:
    mssparkutils.fs.rm(final_file, True)
except:
    pass

mssparkutils.fs.mv(part_file, final_file)

# cleanup temp folder
mssparkutils.fs.rm(tmp_folder, True)

print("Updated Cases.csv with GUIDs (without overwriting existing GUIDs):", final_file)

from pyspark.sql import functions as F

# Build a small mapping DF: Case ID -> GUID
case_guid_map = (
    cases_df2
    .select(
        F.col("Case ID").alias("caseNodeId_str"),
        F.col("GUID").alias("caseGuid")
    )
    .dropDuplicates(["caseNodeId_str"])
)

# Join onto df_mapped
df_mapped = (
    df_mapped
    .withColumn("caseNodeId_str", F.col("caseNodeId").cast("string"))
    .join(case_guid_map, on="caseNodeId_str", how="left")
    .drop("caseNodeId_str")
)

# Optional: sanity check rows missing a GUID (should be 0 for filtered set)
display(df_mapped.filter(F.col("caseGuid").isNull()).select("caseNodeId").distinct())

row_sample = (
    df_mapped
    .withColumn("caseNodeId_str", F.col("caseNodeId").cast("string"))
    .filter(F.col("caseNodeId_str").isin(case_ids))
    .orderBy("caseNodeId_str")
    .drop("caseNodeId_str")
)

display(row_sample)  # nice table view in notebook

row_sample.write \
    .mode("overwrite") \
    .option("header", True) \
    .csv("abfss://horizon-migration-poc@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net/MPESC-TRANSFORM/case-merged-sample-row")
